intro: Hieracium mattfeldianum subsp. banderitzae, commonly known as the Banderitz's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. This subspecies is noted for its limited distribution and is considered a rare and localized plant.
